reviews.review_msg: Enda truly cares about his students and the subject matter in this course. He's passionate about what he's teaching and it comes across in the way he conducts class. Extremely fair marker and always ready to help his students. Would definitely take another class with him - wish more CMNS profs genuinely cared about their students as Enda does!

Worst professor I have had at SFU. Dry lectures which only deviated from the text on the slides for unrelated and oft-repeated personal anecdotes. Class was listed as a seminar but did little to encourage discussion and engagement with the material. Struggles with technology to an extent that is frustrating and impacts her ability to teach. Avoid.

Seminar was a little scattered but highly interesting. Really knows her stuff on the topic and has worked with amazing people in the field. She really goes out of her way to make sure you do well in the class. Don't take the class if you're just looking to fill upper level credits - should have an interest in the arts.
Art World is one of the most interesting courses in CMNS. Jan is nice and helpful. Great course materials and very useful approaches for cultural studies.
